titlePart.text: SECTION F MECHANICAL ENGINEERING
LIGHTING
HEATING
WEAPONS
BLASTING
ENGINEERING IN GENERAL
ENGINEERING ELEMENTS OR UNITS
GENERAL MEASURES FOR PRODUCING AND MAINTAINING EFFECTIVE FUNCTIONING OF MACHINES OR INSTALLATIONS
THERMAL INSULATION IN GENERAL
PIPES
JOINTS OR FITTINGS FOR PIPES
SUPPORTS FOR PIPES OR CABLES
MEANS FOR THERMAL INSULATION IN GENERAL

noteParagraph.text: In this sub-class, the word "pipes" is understood to include all pipes and tubes not specially adapted to purposes other than that of conveying fluids, materials, or objects. A pipe may or may not be flexible; if flexibility is essential the word "hose" is used.

titlePart.text: Laying or reclaiming pipes
titlePart.entryReference: making special pipe joints, see the relevant groups for the joints
conduits made of concrete in situ
machines for digging trenches in combination with pipe-assembly

titlePart.text: laying pipes in the ground
Laying pipes under water
Supporting
Hangers or supports for pipes or cables
titlePart.entryReference: pipe or rod clamps for scaffolding
staples or hooks having a part for entering a wall or other support ,

titlePart.text: partly surrounding the pipe
pressing the pipe against a wall or other support
with supports for wires
Brackets substantially surrounding the pipe
Divided brackets, i.e. with two members engaging the pipe
comprising a member substantially surrounding the pipe
Hangers in the form of bands or chains
with special provision allowing movement of the pipe
titlePart.entryReference: for pipes supported in outer sleeve

titlePart.text: allowing movement in axial direction
allowing movement in transverse direction
Spring-systems therefor
specially adapted to supporting a number of parallel pipes
with special member for attachment to profiled girders
Devices for use where pipes pass through walls or partitions
sealing the pipe in the wall or partition
Supporting of pipes inside other pipes or sleeves, e.g. for enabling pipes or cables to be inserted or withdrawn from under roads or railways without interruption of traffic

wound from sheets or strips, with or without reinforcement

Pipes composed of a plurality of segments
Hoses, i.e. flexible pipes
made of fibres or threads, e.g. of textile
made of rubber or flexible plastics
with homogeneous wall
with reinforcements embedded in the wall
with reinforcements not embedded in the wall
with corrugated wall
with arrangements for special purposes, e.g. specially profiled, with protecting layer, heated, electrically conducting
made of rigid material, e.g. metal or hard plastics
wound from profiled strips or bands
Articulated hoses, e.g. composed of a series of rings
Pipe joints
Hose nipples
titlePart.entryReference: special adaptations of pipe joints for use with water-closet bowls

titlePart.text: Non-disconnectible pipe joints, e.g. soldered, adhesive, or caulked joints
titlePart.entryReference: joints for rigid pipes of plastics

titlePart.text: Welded joints
with arrangements preventing overstressing
with tension-relief of the weld by means of detachable members, e.g. divided tensioning rings, bolts in flanges
Soldered joints
Adhesive or cemented joints
using materials which fill the space between parts of a joint before hardening
with a seal made of lead, caulked packing, or the like
made by plastically deforming the material of the pipe, e.g. by flanging, rolling
Screw-threaded joints
titlePart.entryReference: joints sealed primarily by means other than engagement of screw-threads, see the relevant groups characterised by the sealing arrangements

titlePart.text: Forms of screw-threads for such joints
allowing substantial longitudinal adjustment by the use of a long screw-threaded part
with additional sealings
Joints with packing adapted to sealing by fluid pressure
titlePart.entryReference: sealings tightened by external pressure, inflatable packings

titlePart.text: with sealing rings arranged between outer surface of pipe and inner surface of sleeve or socket
having annular axial lips
with longitudinally split or divided sleeve
with sealing rings arranged between the end surfaces of the pipes or flanges or arranged in recesses in the pipe ends or flanges
Joints in which sealing surfaces are pressed together by means of a member, e.g. a swivel nut, screwed on or into one of the joint parts
titlePart.entryReference: if using bolts or equivalent connecting means

titlePart.text: Pipe ends provided with collars or flanges, integral with the pipe or not, pressed together by a screwed member
with flexible sealing rings between the sealing surfaces
using additional rigid rings, sealing directly on at least one pipe end, which is flared either before or during the making of the connection
in which radial clamping is obtained by wedging action on non-deformed pipe ends
adapted for use in socket or sleeve connections
with metal rings which bite into the wall of the pipe
Joints with sleeve or socket
with elastic sealing rings between pipe and sleeve or between pipe and socket, e.g. with rolling or other prefabricated profiled rings
in which sealing rings are compressed by axially-movable members
with a divided sleeve or ring clamping around the pipe ends
with additional locking means
Flanged joints
the flanges being connected by members tensioned axially
the flanges being connected by members tensioned in the radial plane
Constructive types of pipe joints not provided for in groups
titlePart.entryReference: specially adapted to be made of plastics or to be used with pipes made of plastics

titlePart.text: Electrically insulating joints or couplings
Adjustable joints
Joints allowing movement
titlePart.entryReference: for double-walled or multi-channel pipes or pipe assemblies

titlePart.text: Universal joints, i.e. with mechanical connection allowing angular movement or adjustment of the axes of the parts in any direction
with partly-spherical engaging surfaces
with special sealing means between the engaging surfaces
allowing adjustment or movement only about the axis of one pipe
comprising a flexible connection only
allowing substantial longitudinal adjustment or movement
Joints with fluid cut-off means
Arrangements for connecting hoses to one another or to flexible sleeves

titlePart.text: Rigid hose-connectors, i.e. single members engaging both hoses
adapted for hoses having a multi-layer wall
Hose-clips
tightened by tangentially-arranged threaded pin and nut
in which the threaded pin is rigid with the hose-encircling member
in which a worm coacts with a part of the hose-encircling member that is toothed like a worm-wheel
with a substantially-radial tightening member
with a pivoted or swinging tightening or securing member, e.g. toggle lever
with a taping-bolt, i.e. winding up the end of the hose-encircling member
with sealing or securing means using fluid pressure
characterised by the use of additional sealing means
Undivided rings, sleeves, or like members contracted on the hose or expanded inside the hose by means of tools
Arrangements using such members
with means not mentioned in the preceding groups for gripping the hose between inner and outer parts
the outer parts being segmented, the segments being pressed against the hose by wedging action
with parts screwed directly on or into the hose
specially adapted for hoses made of metal
Special arrangements used in connection with end fittings of hoses, e.g. safety or protecting devices
Couplings of the quick-acting type
titlePart.entryReference: connections made automatically when vehicles are brought together ,

titlePart.text: in which the connection is maintained only by friction of the parts being joined
with an elastic outer part pressing against an inner part by reason of its elasticity
tightened by fluid pressure
in which the connection between abutting or axially-overlapping ends is maintained by locking members
using a rotary external sleeve or ring on one part
using hooks, pawls, or other movable or insertable locking members
Joints secured by inserting between mating surfaces an element, e.g. a piece of wire, a pin, a chain
Joints tightened by the action of wedge-shaped hinged hooks
Joints tightened by eccentrics or rotatable cams
Joints tightened by toggle-action levers
in which the connection is maintained by means of balls, rollers, or helical springs under radial pressure between the parts
in which the connection is made by inserting one member axially into the other and rotating it to a limited extent, e.g. with bayonet-action
in which the connection is made by transversely moving the parts together, with or without their subsequent rotation
with fluid cut-off means
Joints or fittings for double-walled or multi-channel pipes or pipe assemblies
for hoses
allowing adjustment or movement

connections not designed for conveying fluid

titlePart.text: Branch units, e.g. made in one piece, welded, riveted

titlePart.text: making use of attaching means embracing the pipe

titlePart.entryReference: the preceding groups and groups , take precedence
devices for preventing bursting of water pipes by freezing

titlePart.text: Energy absorbers
Noise absorbers
Devices damping pulsations or vibrations in fluids

venting or aerating devices per se

Means, e.g. clamps, for flattening hoses

Preventing accumulation of dirt or other matter in pipes, e.g. by traps, by strainers
Protection of pipes or objects of similar shape against external or internal damage or wear
